techniques.comment: Covered by checking for bad files in user writable folders in %WINDIR%
Covered by checking all of the SIP and Trust Providers on the system
Checks a variety of firewall/Windows Security Notification Center settings (M1028-WFW, M1054-WSC, V-73511) and looks for bypasses to Windows Firewall in the Registry (T1089)
Covered by checking for printer ports that reference a file (CVE-2020-1048)
Covered by checking the port monitors on the system and their associated drivers
Covered by checking all configured CLSIDs and their associated files
Covered by checking all Netsh Helper Dlls and monitoring for them
Covered by checking Services key/subkeys and analyzing each of the binaries
Covered by checking EventLogs for Security/4698, Task-Scheduler/106 events and monitoring for these events
Covered by checking EventLogs for Security/4720 events and monitoring for these events
Covered by registry checking HKCU\Environment\UserInitMprLogonScript
Covered by registry checking AppInit_DLLs and LoadAppInit_DLLs keys
Coverd by checking most Run* keys. Future coverage will be obtained through checking files in Startup folders
Covered by registry checking AppCert DLLs
Covered by registry checking for Application Shimming and Custom DBs
Covered by registry checking for any additional SSPs
Covered by registry checking for any additional Auth/Notif Packages
Covered by registry checking the Notify, Userinit, and Shell values
Covered by analyzing files in web locations for bad functions/strings
Covered by notifying a user when event logs are created for new service creation.
Covered by scanning all running processes for indicators of process injection.
Covered by scanning all running processes for indicators of process injection.
Covered by scanning all running processes for indicators of process injection.
Covered by checking Registry keys for Image File Execution Options.
Disables Wdigest which limits effectiveness of Credential Dumping (V-72753)
Runs LSASS as a PPL and requires drivers loaded into LSASS to be signed by Microsoft (M1025). DLL Safe Search mode is enabled (V-3479)
Disables LLMNR and NBT-NS to prevent against LLMNR/NBT-NS spoofing attacks (M1042-LLMNR, M1042-NBT)
Disables Windows Script Hosts which prevents some scripts from executing (M1042-WSH)
Limits anonymous access to shares (V-1093)
Filters Admin tokens over the network (V-63597)
A number of settings to strengthen UAC are applied (V-63817)
Covered by registry checking looking for Debuggers and YARA scanning Accessibility Files
Covered by checking Sysmon Logs for EID 2 events, YARA scanning those files, and monitoring for these events
DLL Safe Search mode is enabled (V-3479)
Covered by checking Services in the registry for things like FailureCommands that are suspicious.
Covered by checking for ntuser.man files in all user directories and monitoring for these files
